tools.name: MONDAY_DELETE_ASSET
tools.description: Tool to remove uploaded files. Since monday.com doesn't provide a direct asset deletion API, this tool deletes the enclosing update or clears files from a File column.

inputSchema.title: DeleteAssetRequest

target.title: Target
target.description: Deletion strategy: 'update' to delete the update, or 'column' to clear a File column

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: Item ID whose File column should be cleared (used when target is 'column').

asset_id.title: Asset Id
asset_id.description: The unique identifier of the asset related to the removal operation.

board_id.title: Board Id
board_id.description: Board ID of the item (used when target is 'column').

column_id.title: Column Id
column_id.description: File column ID to clear (used when target is 'column'). For example: 'files'.

update_id.title: Update Id
update_id.description: ID of the update that contains the attachment to remove (used when target is 'update').

inputSchema.description:
Request model to remove uploaded files from Monday.com.

Note: monday.com does not expose a direct "delete asset by ID" mutation.
This action provides two supported strategies:
- target="update": delete the update that contains the attachment (requires update_id)
- target="column": clear all files from a File column value (requires board_id, item_id, column_id)

The asset_id is accepted for audit/logging purposes and to align with prior schema,
but the deletion is executed against the update or file column value rather than
the asset object itself.
